Upload the academic policy for institution with regards to student attendance in theory and practical, dress code, professional conduct and disciplinary actions of students in clinic and classroom, a policy for students to file grievances regarding results

select1.label: Functional computer labs are available with minimum 5 working computers
Regular computer classes scheduled in the time table for students
Students are using lab regularly (as per the attendance register)
Course syllabus is developed and distributed in units
Faculty has developed a lesson plan
Master rotation plan (MRP) / Academic Roaster is displayed - theory, clinical posting, exams, vacations are mentioned according to syllabus prescribed
Faculty specify the unit/topic that is being taught in each class
Faculty uses the developed lesson plan in class while teaching
Learning objectives are discussed with students
AV aids like projector, overhead projector, white/black board are being used for classroom facilitation
Teachers utilise the learning labs regularly for skills demonstration
Procedure checklist is available with students and faculty for demonstration
Opportunities are given to the students for practicing demonstrated skills
Return demonstration / skill evaluations from students are taken for each skill demonstrated
Clinical Rotation Plan / Clinical Duty Roaster for each class of students exists
Developed clinical objective and shared with clinical site staffs
Clinical Rotation Plan / Clinical Duty Roaster has student distribution, area of posting as per curriculum and faculty responsible for each block
Clinical Rotation Plan / Clinical Duty Roaster copy is shared with clinical site staffs
Clinical attendance registers for faculty are maintained
Procedure checklist is available with faculty
Procedure checklist is available with students
Faculty record activities conducted during clinical supervision on a daily basis
Pre-post clinical discussions are conducted on daily basis
Students daily activities are monitored and recorded
How many internal exams are conducted in a year for each batch
Students are informed about exams at least 1 week in advance through a notice
